intro: Argyrolobium parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered silver-lobed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low-growing habit with clustered stems and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Argyrolobium parviflorum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
